qas.question: During the 1920s, who was the mayor of Atlantic City?
What three contributions to Atlantic City was Edward L. Bader known for?
What year did Edward L. Bader lead the initiative to construct the Atlantic City High School?
How much was the bond for that was to be used to purchase land for a Convention Center?
What year was Boardwalk Hall finished?

context: During this time, Atlantic City was under the mayoral reign of <a0_0>Edward L. Bader<a0_0/>, known for his contributions to the <a1_0>construction, athletics and aviation<a1_0/> of Atlantic City. Despite the opposition of many others, he purchased land that became the city's municipal airport and high school football stadium, both of which were later named Bader Field in his honor. He led the initiative, in <a2_0>1923<a2_0/>, to construct the Atlantic City High School at Albany and Atlantic Avenues. Bader, in November 1923, initiated a public referendum, during the general election, at which time residents approved the construction of a Convention Center. The city passed an ordinance approving a bond issue for <a3_0>$1.5 million<a3_0/> to be used for the purchase of land for Convention Hall, now known as the Boardwalk Hall, finalized September 30, <a4_0>1924<a4_0/>. Bader was also a driving force behind the creation of the Miss America competition.
